command: $evs = Get-WinEvent -LogName 'Microsoft-Windows-DNS-Client/Operational' -MaxEvents 1000 | Where-Object { $_.Id -in 3008,3009 } | ForEach-Object { $_.Properties[2].Value } | Where-Object { $_ } | Select-Object -Unique; $susp = $evs | Where-Object { ($_ -split '\.')[0] -match '[a-z]{6,}\d{3,}' -or $_.Length -gt 30 }; $payload = @{ timestamp=(Get-Date).ToUniversalTime().ToString('o'); suspected=$susp } | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 3; Invoke-WebRequest -UseBasicParsing -ContentType 'application/json' -Method POST -Body $payload 'https://siem.example.local/api/ingest/dns-dga'
explanation: Defensive telemetry for T1568: analyzes DNS Client Operational log for domains with DGA-like patterns and reports to SIEM using Invoke-WebRequest.
rationale_steps: Read recent DNS query events from Windows DNS Client Operational log.
Apply simple heuristic for DGA-like patterns (long labels, alphanumeric mix).
